snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission accused a special facilities district in Wenatchee, Wash., of misleading investors about an ice-rink project’s viability, and fined the district $20,000.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission accuses special facilities district in Wenatchee, Wash, of misleading investors about an ice-rink project’s viability, and fines district $20,000; penalty is strong signal that SEC is serious about clamping down on misbehavior by municipal bond issuers.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission accused a special facilities district in Wenatchee, Wash., of misleading investors about an ice-rink project’s viability, and fined the district $20,000.

headline.main: S.E.C. Clamping Down on Issuers of Bonds
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Clamping Down on Issuers of Bonds
